intro: Aphananthemum, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in diverse habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plants are characterized by their small, delicate flowers that are often hidden among the foliage, giving them their common name. Aphananthemum species typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow blooms. These plants are adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making them resilient to drought and heat.
